attributes.long_name: mapping between sub_image and polarisation
mapping between sub_image and swath
zero doppler start time of the output image
zero doppler stop time of the output image
zero doppler azimuth time to which grid point applies
two-way slant range time to grid point
reference image measurement data set line to which this geolocation grid point applies
reference image measurement data set sample to which this geolocation grid point applies
geodetic latitude of grid point
geodetic longitude of grid point
height of the grid point above ellipsoid
incidence angle to grid point
elevation angle to grid point
zero doppler azimuth time of terrain height measurement
average terrain height above ellipsoid, the value is the average height in the range direction for the given zero-doppler azimuth time
zero-doppler azimuth time at which parameters apply
two-way slant range time to first range sample
slant range origin used for ground range calculation

coefficients to convert from slant range to ground range, ground range = g0 + g1(sr-sr0) + g2(sr-sr0)^2 + g3(sr-sr0)^3 + g4(sr-sr0)^4...+ gN(sr-sr0)^N where sr is the slant range distance to the desired pixel and N is the number of coefficients in the array minus one
ground range origin used for ground range calculation

coefficients to convert from ground range to slant range, slant range = s0 + s1(gr-gr0) + s2(gr-gr0)^2 + s3(gr-gr0)^3 + s4(gr-gr0)^4...+ sN(gr-gr0)^N where gr is the ground range distance to the desired pixel and N is the number of coefficients in the array minus one

swath identifier for this data set, this element identifies the swath that applies to all data contained within this data set (the swath identifier EW is used for products in which the 5 EW swaths have been merged, and IW is used for products in which the 3 IW swaths have been merged)
zero-doppler azimuth time of first azimuth line
first azimuth line of the swath boundary
first range sample of the swath boundary
last azimuth line of the swath boundary
last range sample of the swath boundary
overall product quality index, this annotation is calculated from specific quality parameters and gives an overall quality value to the product
calculated mean of the input data for the i channel
calculated mean of the input data for the q channel
false if the mean of i and q input values are both within specified range of expected mean (x between x-threshold and x+threshold), true otherwise
calculated standard deviation of the input data for the i channel
calculated standard deviation of the input data for the q channel
false if the standard deviation values of i and q input values are both within specified range of expected standard deviation (x between x-threshold to x+threshold), true otherwise
number of downlink gaps detected in the input data

significant downlink input data gap is defined as a contiguous block of N downlink missing lines (the value of N is predefined for each product); false if number of downlink input gaps is less than or equal to the threshold value, true if number of downlink input data gaps is more than the threshold value

number of downlink missing lines detected in the input data, excluding data gaps (a downlink missing line is defined as any echo line physically absent from the input data file due to a downlink error)
false if the percentage of downlink missing lines is less than or equal to the threshold value, true if the percentage of downlink missing lines is more than the threshold value
number of instrument gaps detected in the input data

significant instrument input data gap is defined as a contiguous block of N instrument missing lines (the value of N is predefined for each product); false if the number of instrument input gaps is less than or equal to the threshold value, true if number of instrument input data gaps is more than the threshold value

number of instrument missing lines detected in the input data, excluding data gaps (an instrument missing line is defined as any echo line physically absent from the input data file due to a failure by the instrument to produce the expected echo line)
false if the percentage of instrument missing lines is less than or equal to the threshold value, true if the percentage of instrument missing lines is more than the threshold value
number of gaps detected in the input data due to the SSB error flag being set

significant SSB error input data gap is defined as a contiguous block of N lines in which the SSB error flag is set to true (the value of N is predefined for each product); false if the number of SSB error input gaps is less than or equal to the threshold value, true if number of SSB error input data gaps is more than the threshold value
number of SSB error missing lines detected in the input data, excluding data gaps (an SSB error missing line is defined as any echo line in which the SSB error flag is set to true)
false if the percentage of SSB error missing lines is less than or equal to the threshold value, true if the percentage of SSB error missing lines is more than the threshold value
chirp source used during process (nominal or extracted) (this value is a copy of the value from the processing information record)
power gain source used during process (model or extract) (this value is a copy of the value from the processing information record)
type of range replica function used (unextended, extended flat, extended tapered) (this value is a copy of the value from the processing options record)

false if able to reconstruct at least one valid extracted chirp replica during process, true if unable to reconstruct any valid extracted replica during process (a replica is valid if it was successfully reconstructed and all quality measures were acceptable), if this flag is true then the processor uses the nominal range pulse and a nominal elevation beam scaling factor
mean of all power gain product amplitude values
standard deviation of all power gain product amplitude values
mean value of all power gain product phase values
standard deviation of all power gain product phase values

false if the percentage of invalid relative and absolute pg products is below the configured threshold, true otherwise (if this flag is set to true then the values from the pg product model are used in place of the derived pg product values)
false if all parameters read from the downlinked data were valid, true if any downlink parameter is out of range and therefore a default value has been used
calculated i bias (this value is a copy of the value from the raw data analysis record)
true if i bias falls within acceptable range, false otherwise
calculated q bias (this value is a copy of the value from the raw data analysis record)
true if q bias falls within acceptable range, false otherwise
calculated i/q gain imbalance (this value is a copy of the value from the raw data analysis record)
true if i/q gain imbalance falls within acceptable range, false otherwise
calculated i/q quadrature departure
true if quadrature departure falls within acceptable range, false otherwise

doppler centroid estimation method used during process (both the doppler centroid calculated from orbit geometry and the one estimated from the raw data are annotated within the doppler data set; however, this parameter describes the actual method used during image processing) (this value is a copy of the value from the processing options record)

false if the RMS error for the DCE method used for image process is less than the specified threshold, true if the RMS error is more than or equal to the specified threshold (if more than one doppler centroid estimation is performed, the flag is set if any RMS error is more than or equal to the threshold)
mean value of output data
standard deviation of output data

false if the mean of i and q output values for SLC image or mean of detected pixels for a detected product, are both within specified range from expected mean (x between x-threshold and x+threshold), true otherwise

false if the std of i and q output values for SLC image or std of detected pixels for a detected product, are both within specified range from expected std (x between x-threshold and x+threshold), true otherwise
swath from which this downlink information data was extracted
zero doppler azimuth time at which this set of downlink information applies
sensing time of first line of input data
sensing time of last line of input data
pulse repetition frequency of the input raw data (this is the inverse of the pulse repetition interval extracted from the downlink information for this swath)
number of errors detected in the sync marker field
number of errors detected in the data take identifier field
number of errors detected in the event control code number field
number of errors detected in the test mode field
number of errors detected in the receive channel identifier field
number of errors detected in the instrument configuration identifier field
number of errors detected in the space packet count field
number of errors detected in the pulse repetition interval count field
number of packets in which the setting selector bus error flag is set to true
number of errors detected in the block adaptative quantisation mode field
number of errors detected in the adaptative quantisation block length field
number of errors detected in the range decimation field
number of errors detected in the receive gain field
number of errors detected in the transmit ramp rate field
number of errors detected in the transmit pulse start frequency field
number of errors detected in the rank field
number of errors detected in the pulse repetition interval code field
number of errors detected in the sampling window start time field
number of errors detected in the sampling window length field
number of errors detected in the polarisation field
number of errors detected in the temperature compensation field
number of errors detected in the elevation beam address field
number of errors detected in the azimuth beam address field
number of errors detected in the synthetic antenna system test mode field
number of errors detected in the calibration operation type field
number of errors detected in the calibration beam address field
number of errors detected in the calibration mode field
number of errors detected in the transmit pulse number field
number of errors detected in the signal type field
number of errors detected in the swap flag field
number of errors detected in the swath number field
number of errors detected in the number of quads field
total number of errors detected in instrument source packet headers
pulse repetition interval
number of pulse repetition intervals between transmitted pulse and return echo
event control code number of the measurement or test mode
receive channel identifier
instrument configuration identifier
applied value of the commandable receive attenuation in the receiver channel of the synthetic electronic system

transmit pulse length (this field is set to the nominal tx pulse length from the input AUX_INS data if it is more than zero and less than the tx pulse length extracted from the ISP headers; otherwise, this field is set to the tx pulse length extracted from the ISP headers)
starting frequency of the transmit pulse
linear frequency modulation rate at which the frequency changes over the pulse duration
SPPDU swath number identifier
zero doppler azimuth time of sampling window start change
sampling window start time
zero doppler azimuth time of sampling window length change
sampling window length
adaptive quantisation block length for all packets
data format of echo packets
data format of noise packets
data format of calibration packets
calculated mean bit rate of fdbaq decompression for the entire segment
filter bandwidth used to decimate the instrument signal data
sampling frequency of the instrument signal data after decimation (this frequency is equivalent to the sampling frequency before decimation multiplied by the decimation ratio)
length of the decimation filter
zero doppler azimuth time at which the pointing status applies
attitude and orbit control system operational mode
false when the roll axis is nominally pointed and true when the roll axis is degraded
false when the pitch axis is nominally pointed and true when the pitch axis is degraded
false when the yaw axis is nominally pointed and true when the yaw axis is degraded
zero doppler azimuth time at which this analysis applies
calculated i bias (this value is a copy of the value from the raw data analysis record)
calculated q bias (this value is a copy of the value from the raw data analysis record)
calculated i/q quadrature departure
calculated i/q gain imbalance (this value is a copy of the value from the raw data analysis record)
i bias upper bound
i bias lower bound
q bias upper bound
q bias lower bound
i/q gain upper bound
i/q gain lower bound
i/q quadrature departure upper bound
i/q quadrature departure lower bound
i channel bias used for correction (may be different from the calculated bias)
q channel bias used for correction (may be different from the calculated bias)
i/q gain imbalance used for correction (may be different from the calculated gain)
i/q quadrature departure used for correction (may be different from the calculated quadrature departure)
swath to which this replica information applies
zero doppler azimuth time at which replica information applies
3dB pulse width of chirp replica cross-correlation function between the reconstructed replica and the nominal replica
peak side lobe ratio of replica cross-correlation function between the reconstructed replica and the nominal replica
integrated side lobe ratio of cross-correlation function between the reconstructed replica and the nominal replica
peak location of cross-correlation function between the reconstructed replica and the nominal replica
true if a valid peak location was found in the cross-correlation between the nominal PG replica and this extracted PG replica, false otherwise

amplitude of the power gain product derived from this replica (the amplitude value is:abs(1/PG * meanRxCalPow(swath1)/meanRxCalPow(swathn)) where abs() is the absolute value function for a complex number, meanRxCalPow(swath1) is the mean rx calibration power of swath 1, meanRxCalPow(swathn) is the mean rx calibration power of the current swath; PG product values can only be calculated for products that have at least one valid extracted reconstructed replica; if no valid extracted reconstructed replica exists within the product then this value is set to the default value of 1.0)

phase of the power gain product derived from this replica [radians] (the phase value is:arg(1/PG * meanRxCalPow(swath1)/meanRxCalPow(swathn)) where arg() is the phase value function for a complex number, meanRxCalPow(swath1) is the mean rx calibration power of swath 1, meanRxCalPow(swathn) is the mean rx calibration power of the current swath; PG product values can only be calculated for products that have at least one valid extracted reconstructed replica; if no valid extracted reconstructed replica exists within the product then this value is set to the default value of 0.0)
PG product amplitude value from the input PG product model
PG product phase value from the input PG product model

true if |pgProductAmplitude - meanPgProductAmplitude| < pgAmpStdFractionThreshold * stdPgProductAmplitude and |pgProductPhase - meanPgProductPhase| < pgPhaseStdFractionThreshold * stdPgProductPhase, false otherwise; PG product values can only be calculated and validated for products that have at least one valid extracted reconstructed replica; if no valid extracted reconstructed replica exists within the product then this flag is set to false for every replica record

true if |pgProductAmplitude - modelPgProductAmplitude| < maxPgAmpErrorThreshold and |pgProductPhase - modelPgProductPhase| < maxPgPhaseErrorThreshold, false otherwise; PG product values can only be calculated and validated for products that have at least one valid extracted reconstructed replica; if no valid extracted reconstructed replica exists within the product then this flag is set to false for every replica record
internal time delay representing the calculated deviation of the location of this PG replica from the location of the transmitted pulse or nominal PG replica
zero doppler azimuth time at which reference replica applies
chirp source used for range compression
power gain source used during process
reference replica amplitude coefficients in single precision floating point values
reference replica phase coefficients in single precision floating point values

internal time delay representing the mean deviation of the replica location from the location of the transmitted pulse (if the pg source is model, then this value is filled with the time delay parameter from the AUX_INS file; if the pg source is extracted, then this value is filled with the mean internal time delay calculated across all valid extracted PG replicas reconstructed from the calibration pulses at 100 MHz bandwidth)
complex gain to be applied to the range match filter to compensate for the amplitude and phase differences between the two channels in dual polarization data

zero doppler azimuth time to the mid-slant range of the first line of the image (when bi-static correction is performed, this is the time of the image of the ground; when bi-static correction is not performed, this is the time of the reception of the echo)

zero doppler azimuth time to the mid-slant range of the last line of the image (when bi-static correction is performed, this is the time of the image of the ground; when bi-static correction is not performed, this is the time of the reception of the echo)
ascending node crossing time before the start of the image

zero doppler reference time used for process (if the product is a slice product, this is the time of the first slice within a segment and all slices within the segment report the same time value; otherwise, this is the same as the product first line time)
product composition indicator, where the valid values are: individual, for full non-sliced product; slice, for single slice of a larger product; assembled, for product combining multiple slices
two-way slant range time to first sample
if product composition type is slice, this is the number of the current slice within the multi-slice segment; if product composition type is individual or assembled, the slice number is 0
if product composition type is slice, this is the number of the current slice within the multi-slice segment; if product composition type is individual or assembled, the slice number is 0
interpretation of the image pixels within the image measurement data set (detected or complex)
data type of output pixels within the image measurement data set
pixel space between range samples
nominal pixel space between range lines
time interval between azimuth lines of the output image
azimuth line frequency of the output image (this is the inverse of the azimuth time interval)
total number of samples in the output image (image width)
total number of lines in the output image (image length)
time difference between zero doppler time and acquisition time of output image lines
incidence angle at mid swath
mean value of output data
standard deviation of output data
sensing start time of this slice (if this slice entry is the same as the slice number of the product, this sensing start time is the same as the first line sensing time for the current product)
sensing stop time of this slice (if this slice entry is the same as the slice number of the product, this sensing stop time is the same as the last line sensing time for the current product)
false if correction was done using default parameters, true if correction was done using raw data analysis
true if the orbit data came from an external file, false if the orbit data came from the downlink
true if the attitude data came from an external file, false if the attitude data came from the downlink
false if the receive variation correction was not applied, true if the receive variation correction was applied
false if antenna elevation pattern correction was not applied, true if antenna elevation pattern correction was applied
false if antenna azimuth pattern correction was not applied, true if antenna azimuth pattern correction was applied
false if antenna azimuth element pattern correction was not applied, true if antenna azimuth element pattern correction was applied

doppler centroid estimation method used during process (both the DC calculated from orbit geometry and the DC estimated from the raw data are annotated within the doppler data set; however, this parameter describes the actual DC method used during image process)
type of input data used for doppler centroid estimation
false if range spreading loss compensation was not performed, true if range spreading loss compensation was performed
false if slant range to ground range conversion has not been performed, true if slant range to ground range conversion has been performed
false if detection has not been performed, true if detection has been performed
false if thermal noise correction has not been performed, true if thermal noise correction has been performed
when to perform the RFI mitigation: always, never, based_on_noise_meas
in which domain the RFI mitigation should be performed: time, frequency, time&frequency
source of the reference replica: nominal or extracted
power gain source used (model or extract)
spectrum of range replica function used
name of the scaling look-up table applied to compensate for the range spreading loss (set to none if no scaling was applied)
range spreading loss reference slant range (the range spreading loss is compensated by amplitude scaling each range sample by 1/grsl(r) where grsl(r) = cuberoot(rref/r) and r = slant range of sample)
name of the reference ellipsoid used when processing this product
semi-major axis of ellipsoid
semi-minor axis of ellipsoid
false if bi-static delay correction was not applied, true if bi-static delay correction was applied

name of the TOPS filter convention used (this field describes how the TOPS ramping/deramping filters are defined; if set to only_echo_lines then the filter is defined using only the echo lines in a burst; otherwise, if set to all_lines then the filter is defined using all the lines in a burst)

source of the orbit data used, set to ancillary if the orbit information is extracted from the sub-commutated ancillary data in the source packet headers, set to auxiliary if the orbit information is extracted from an input auxiliary file

source of the attitude data used, set to ancillary if the attitude information is extracted from the sub-commutated ancillary data in the source packet headers, set to auxiliary if the attitude information is extracted from an input auxiliary file
swath to which this information applies
processor scaling factor (this value includes the input scaling factor and the range and azimuth oversampling factors from the auxiliary input and is applied multiplicatively to the image data)
name of the used weighting window type
value of the weighting window coefficient
total available bandwidth
used bandwidth
used bandwidth for each look
number of looks
overlap between looks
name of the used weighting window type
value of the weighting window coefficient
total available bandwidth
used bandwidth
used bandwidth for each look
number of looks
overlap between looks
zero doppler azimuth time
swath to which this information applies
number of input range samples for the image or slice
number of input range lines for the image or slice
type of rfi mitigation applied to the data set
sensing time of the noise sequence
true if rfi was detected in the noise sequence
maximum value of the kl divergence statistic in the noise sequence
maximum value of the fisher z statistic in the noise sequence
maximum power spectral density recorded in a frequency bin containing rfi (it is zero if no rfi was found)
zero doppler azimuth time of the first line of the processing block
ratio between in-band and out-of-band power of the burst
percentage of level-0 lines affected by isolated rfi
average percentage of affected level-0 samples in the lines containing rfi
maximum percentage of level-0 samples affected by rfi in the same line
number of sub-blocks in the current burst
number of lines in each sub-block
percentage of blocks affected by persistent rfi
max percentage bandwidth affected by persistent rfi in a single block
percentage of level-0 lines affected by isolated rfi
max percentage of bandwidth affected by isolated rfi in a single line
swath dependent absolute calibration constant
zero doppler azimuth time at which calibration vector applies
image line at which the calibration vector applies

image pixel at which the calibration vector applies (this array contains the count attribute number of integer values (i.e. one value per point in the noise vector); the maximum length of this array is one value for every pixel in an image line, however in general the vector is subsampled)
sigma nought calibration vector (this array contains the count attribute number of floating point values; the values in this vector are aligned with the pixel vector)
beta nought calibration vector (this array contains the count attribute number of floating point values; the values in this vector are aligned with the pixel vector)
gamma calibration vector (this array contains the count attribute number of floating point values; the values in this vector are aligned with the pixel vector)
digital number calibration vector (this array contains the count attribute number of floating point values; the values in this vector are aligned with the pixel vector)
zero doppler azimuth time at which noise vector applies

image line at which the noise vector applies (this array contains the count attribute number of integer values (i.e. one value per point in the noise vector); the maximum length of this array is one value for every line in an image pixel, however in general the vector is subsampled

image pixel at which the noise vector applies (this array contains the count attribute number of integer values (i.e. one value per point in the noise vector); the maximum length of this array is one value for every pixel in an image line, however in general the vector is subsampled
range thermal noise correction vector power values (this array contains the count attribute number of floating point values)
swath to which the noise vector applies
first line at which the noise vector applies
last line at which the noise vector applies
first sample at which the noise vector applies
last sample at which the noise vector applies

image line at which the noise vector applies (this array contains the count attribute number of integer values (i.e. one value per point in the noise vector); the maximum length of this array is one value for every line in an image pixel, however in general the vector is subsampled)
azimuth thermal noise correction vector power values (this array contains the count attribute number of floating point values)
time stamp at which orbit state vectors apply
reference frame of the orbit state data
x component of position vector
y component of position vector
z component of position vector
x component of velocity vector
y component of velocity vector
z component of velocity vector
time stamp at which orbit state vectors apply
reference frame of the orbit state data
q0 attitude quaternion as extracted from ancillary attitude data
q1 attitude quaternion as extracted from ancillary attitude data
q2 attitude quaternion as extracted from ancillary attitude data
q3 attitude quaternion as extracted from ancillary attitude data
x component of angular velocity vector as extracted from ancillary attitude data
y component of angular velocity vector as extracted from ancillary attitude data
z component of angular velocity vector as extracted from ancillary attitude data
platform roll angle calculated from ancillary attitude data
platform pitch angle calculated from ancillary attitude data
platform yaw angle calculated from ancillary attitude data
zero doppler azimuth time
two-way slant range time origin for doppler centroid estimate
azimuth FM rate coefficients array in order of c0 [Hz/s] c1 [Hz/s^2] c2 [Hz/s^3]
zero doppler azimuth time of terrain height measurement
two-way slant range time origin for doppler centroid estimate
doppler centroid estimated from orbit, expressed as polynomial with 5 coefficients: doppler centroid = d0 + d1(tsr-t0) + d2(tsr-t0)^2 + d3(tsr-t0)^3 + d4(tsr-t0)^4, where tsr = 2-way slant range time
doppler centroid estimated from data, expressed as polynomial with 5 coefficients: doppler centroid = d0 + d1(tsr-t0) + d2(tsr-t0)^2 + d3(tsr-t0)^3 + d4(tsr-t0)^4, where tsr = 2-way slant range time

RMS error of the doppler centroid estimate (calculated as the average of the individual RMS residual errors between input fine doppler centroid estimates and the fitted polynomial; if the doppler centroid was not estimated from data, this is set to 0)
false if the RMS error is less than the acceptable threshold for the doppler centroid estimated from the data; true if the RMS error is more than or equal to the acceptable threshold
first zero doppler azimuth time of the block of signal data used for the fine DC estimates
last zero doppler azimuth time of the block of signal data used for the fine DC estimates
two-way slant range time to first sample
fine doppler centroid frequency estimate
swath to which this antenna information applies
zero doppler azimuth time of terrain height measurement
two-way slant range time to sample
elevation angle to grid point

corresponding two-way antenna elevation pattern value for this point (this array contains the count attribute number of complex floating point values (i.e. one value per point in the antenna pattern), in the order I Q I Q I Q... and it contains the same number of values as the slant range time array)
incidence angle to grid point
mean terrain height in range for this antenna pattern (in metres above the ellipsoid) for the given zero-doppler azimuth time
estimated roll angle for this antenna pattern
swath to which this noise information applies
zero doppler azimuth time
noise power correction factor
number of noise lines used to calculate the noise correction factor
measurement data set for GRD IW
map of the polarisation dimension
measurement data set for GRD EW
map of the polarisation dimension
measurement data set for GRD SM
measurement data set for GRD WV1 beam
measurement data set for GRD WV2 beam
